{"rule":"SPACE_BEFORE_PARENTHESIS","sentence":"^\\QThe state weight matrix \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q had every element set to zero, except the entry corresponding to the integrated tracking error \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q, which as initially set to \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q, which resulted in a similar bandwidth to the tuned PIDF(figure \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q), and then increased to \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q, because this increased the bandwidth, but, unlike the PIDF, did not result in amplification at low frequencies.(Figure \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q to \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q).\\E$"}

{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QThe Kalman estimator and the optimal state feedback control law which minimizes the cost function (equation \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q) was computed using MATLAB lqgtrack function.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QUsing optimal control results in a much more precise replication of the ground response spectra at low frequencies, unlike the tuned PIDF which exceeds the desired response spectra in the same band.\\E$"}
{"rule":"A_NNS","sentence":"^\\QHowever, the trade-off for this accuracy at lower frequencies is a response spectra that falls short at higher ones.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QThe optimal controller can be tuned for increasingly larger cut off frequencies without undesired amplification at low frequency, unlike the PIDF, but the results of this is practice may differ from the simulation studies preformed using the current model.\\E$"}
{"rule":"EN_WORD_COHERENCY","sentence":"^\\QIn the system identification menu (figure \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q) the user can apply various filters to the acquired displacement and acceleration signals, and then choose how to synthesise both into a displacement signal.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QAdapt INV Panel menu - This menu is used to generate new driver signals, and takes as inputs the original reference (referred to as target), the driver signal used in the test run, it's measured output at the seismic table, and user defined parameters which affect which parts of the signal are modified, and by how much they're modified.\\E$"}
{"rule":"COMMA_PARENTHESIS_WHITESPACE","sentence":"^\\QFor this section the coupled 2-dof system had both it's masses set to 2000 kg, \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q , \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q, \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q, \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q, and the optimal controller with \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q (as in Figure \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q).\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QThis was simulated by converting a pink noise .drv file (a proprietary file format meant for use with LNEC proprietary software tools: LNEC SPA and Adapt) used in one of LNEC's seismic tests, through the use of a Python library which replicates the functioning of LNEC SPA, which allows the conversion to standard text file, and then providing this signal as input to the MATLAB model previously developed.\\E$"}

{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QFor the seismic signal tested in this section (L'Aquila reduced scale seism), the response spectra from adapted drivers underperforms compared to the PIDF controller, and even more so when compared to the optimal controller.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QIn figure \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q, the identified FRF (figure \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q) used for adapting the drivers is closer to the model, resulting in a better adaptation of the driver signal, but it still requires 3 iterations to somewhat achieve the target response spectrum, and still doesn't perform as well as the optimal and PIDF controllers.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PAST_EXPERIENCE_MEMORY","sentence":"^\\QAnother limitation is the fact that the user does not have exact knowledge of the best settings, because unlike in this example, where the system is known and the FRF is made to match it (Figure \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q), in reality this is not possible, leaving the user to make an informed guess based on the information displayed in Adapt and past experience.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QFrequency response function of identified system using 1024 Low Sidelobe windows results in a rougher approximation of the transfer function, but handles noisy data better.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QFrequency response function of identified system using 20 Hanning windows results in a much better approximation of the transfer function, but likely wouldn't work as well if using noisy sensor data.\\E$"}
